user.title: Connect to Jellyseerr
user.description:
Enter your Jellyseerr server connection details.

**To find your API key:**
1. Open Jellyseerr in your browser
2. Go to Settings → General
3. Copy the API Key from the bottom of the page

**Connection Examples:**
• Local: `192.168.1.100` (port 5055, no SSL)
• Remote: `jellyseerr.mydomain.com` (port 443, SSL enabled)
• Custom port: `mydomain.com` (port 8096, SSL enabled)

data_description.host: IP address or domain name (without http:// or https://)
data_description.port: Port number (usually 5055 for HTTP or 443 for HTTPS)
data_description.ssl: Enable if using HTTPS or if behind a reverse proxy with SSL
data_description.api_key: Found in Jellyseerr Settings → General → API Key

options.title: Configure Jellyseerr Integration
options.description:
**Connection successful!** Found {total_requests} total requests.

Customize how the integration works:

**Fetch Size:** How many recent requests to analyze for status counts. Larger numbers give more accurate counts but use more resources.

**Update Interval:** How often to check for new requests (30 seconds to 1 hour).

**Sensors:** Choose which sensors to create. You can always change these later in the integration options.

data_description.fetch_size: Number of recent requests to fetch (25-200). Higher = more accurate status counts.
data_description.update_interval: How often to update data in seconds (30-3600). Lower = more frequent updates.
data_description.enabled_sensors: Select which sensors to create. Unselected sensors won't appear in Home Assistant.

error.cannot_connect:
Cannot connect to Jellyseerr server. Please check:
• Server address and port are correct
• Jellyseerr is running and accessible
• Firewall/network allows connection
• If using SSL, certificate is valid
error.invalid_api_key:
API key is invalid or doesn't have sufficient permissions. Please:
• Check the API key is copied correctly
• Verify the API key in Jellyseerr Settings → General
• Ensure the API key has proper permissions
error.unknown: An unexpected error occurred. Please check the Home Assistant logs for more details.

abort.already_configured: This Jellyseerr server is already configured. You can modify settings in the integration options.

init.title: Jellyseerr Integration Options
init.description:
Modify how your Jellyseerr integration behaves.

**Note:** Changes take effect after saving and may require a few minutes to apply.

data_description.fetch_size: Number of recent requests to analyze (25-200). Higher numbers give more accurate status counts but use more resources.
data_description.update_interval: How often to check for updates in seconds (30-3600). Lower values mean more frequent updates but higher server load.
data_description.enabled_sensors: Choose which sensors to show in Home Assistant. Disabled sensors will be removed.
